tn.text: This means that Yahweh commanded Moses to have someone make the trumpet. He did not make them himself. AT: "Tell someone to make two silver trumpets" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Moses will not blow the trumpets himself, but he will command the priests to blow them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"while you are present." This means that Moses was to be there with the priest when he blew the trumpets.

tn.ref: the leaders, the heads of the clans of Israel
tn.text: the leaders, the heads of the clans of Israel These two phrases refer to the same group of people. Here the second phrase is used to describe the first phrase. AT: "the leaders, who are the heads of the clans of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: When you blow a loud signal
tn.text: Here the word "you" is plural. Yahweh is speaking to Moses, but he his referring to the priests. The priests will blow the trumpets, Moses will not. AT: "When they blow a loud signal" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: When you blow a loud signal
tn.text: Here the word "you" is plural. Yahweh is speaking to Moses, but he is referring to the priests. The priests will blow the trumpets, Moses will not. AT: "When they blow a loud signal" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"To gather the community together"
"2nd" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: They must blow a loud signal for their journeys
tn.text: "They" refers to the priests and the word "their" refers to the people of Israel.
"be a rule for you." Here  "you" is plural and refers to the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: When you go to war ... oppresses you
tn.text: Yahweh is speaking to Moses and uses the word "you," but he is actually referring the people of Israel going to war. AT: "When the people of Israel to war ... oppresses Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: then you must sound an alarm with the trumpets
tn.text: Here Yahweh again speaks to Moses using the word "you" but actually wants Moses to have the priests blow the trumpets. AT: "then you must command the priests to sound an alarm with the trumpets" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This phrase "call to mind" means to remember. AT: "remember you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The noun "celebration" can be expressed with the verb "celebrate." AT: "when you celebrate" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

Here Yahweh again speaks to Moses using the word "you," but actually wants him to have the priests blow the trumpets. AT: "you must command the priests to blow the trumpets" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]]),

tn.ref: at the beginnings of the months
tn.text: There are 12 months on the Hebrew calendar. The beginning phase of the moon with its sliver of light marked the beginning of each month in the lunar calendar. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]]

tn.ref: your burnt offerings ... your fellowship offerings ... you to me
tn.text: In these phrases the words "your" and "you" are plural and refer to the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"in honor of the sacrifices"

tn.ref: will act as a reminder of you to me
tn.text: "will act as a memorial for you of me." The word "reminder" can be expressed with the verb "remind." AT: "will always remind you of me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "these" refers to the trumpets and the sacrifices.
"In the 2nd year" or "In year 2." This is the second year after Yahweh brought the Israelites out of Egypt. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: in the second month, on the twentieth day of the month
tn.text: "in the 2nd month, on the 20th day of the month." This is the second month of the Hebrew calendar. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
This can be stated in active form.  AT: "the cloud rose up" (UDB) or "Yahweh lifted the cloud" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the tabernacle of the covenant decrees
tn.text: The tabernacle was also called by this longer name because the ark with the law of God was placed inside it. Translate this the same way as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:01:50|1:50]].
This can be stated in active form. AT: "the commands that Yahweh had given through Moses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: The camp under the banner of Judah's descendants
tn.text: This camp includes the three tribes under the division of Judah: Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun.
"went out 1st." The phrase "went out" means that they packed up their camp and began moving. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.text: This refers to the armies of the tribes under the division of Dan: Dan, Asher, and Naphtali.

"that Yahweh described to us"
"we will treat you well"

tn.ref: You must watch out for us
tn.text: The phrase "watch out" means to guide and to take care of. AT: "You can guide us and show us how to live in the desert" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"They" refers to the people of Israel.
This refers to Mount Sinai. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "Mount Sinai, the mountain of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: The ark of the covenant of Yahweh went before them
tn.text: The group of Levites carrying the ark of the covenant went before the people of Israel as the traveled. AT: "Men carried the ark of the covenant of Yahweh before them as they traveled" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
"every day" or "during the day"

Here the ark is spoken of as if were a person traveling. The ark was really being carried by men. AT: "Whenever the people carrying the ark set out" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
Here the phrase "rise up" is a request for Yahweh to act, in this case Moses is asking him to scatter their enemies. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Make those who hate you run from you
tn.text: Here Moses speaks about Yahweh causing their enemies to flee from the people of Israel as if they were fleeing from Yahweh himself. AT: "Make those who hate you run away from your ark and your people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

Here the ark is spoken of as if were a person traveling. The ark was really being carried by men. AT: "Whenever the people carrying the ark stopped" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
This refers to people. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "many tens of thousands of people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
